content: Generally, reinstalling does not fix problems, but if you plan to reinstall, I suggest being extra safe. To do that, I suggest: - exit thunderbird - copy the profile elsewhere, whether to an external drive or to another place on disk. the profile is at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird - reinstall thunderbird and exit - copy the saved profile thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the default thunderbird folder - restart thunderbird and everything will be there.
creator: davidsk

content: Your thunderbird addressbook is named abook.sqlite and can be imported at tools>import. Your gmail addressbook can be added at the addressbook menu and select to add a cardDAV addressbook. Then use your gmail address to set it up.
creator: davidsk

content: If you lost your password, I encourage you to contact your email provider to reset the password. Thunderbird has no ability provide new passwords.
creator: davidsk

content: All I can suggest is to omit the password. The login to a google account assumes (as I understand it) the password is an app password. Since what you entered is not, the login fails. If there is no password, google prompts for the id and then shows an 'allow' link to continue. That has been my experience and that approach has worked for many.
creator: davidsk

content: Check to be sure you did not check to save messages in the folder of the message being replied to. That option is in the 'copies&folder' pane. Other than that, I have no suggestions.

creator: christ1

content: The simplest way I have found to match a csv with Thunderbird's preferences is this: - with at least one email address in the addressbook, export a csv from thunderbird. - this is now your template. View it in a spreadsheet program and compare to the csv file that you want to import. - adjust the columns in your csv to mirror the columns in the exported csv. - now the import should go smoothly.
creator: davidsk

content: Možnosti nápravy. 1. Robí to niektorý už nekompatibilný doplnok. Odporúčam vypnúť všetky doplnky - a malo by byť po probléme. Potom postupne zapínať jednotlivé doplnky, až zistite, ktorý to robí. Ten doplnok ktorý to spôsobuje dočasne zakázať dovtedy, pokiaľ autor tohoto doplnku neurobí opravu a neaktualizuje ho pre najnovšiu verziu Thunderbirdu. 2. Tento problém tiež spôsoboval agresívne nastavený antivírusový program. Skúste mu pre kontrolu pridať výnimku, alebo ho úplne vypnúť (odstrániť). Spravidla sú sťažnosti na Avast u ktorého ale vraj stačí iba vypnúť "Štít súborového systému". 3. Vo viacerých prípadoch tiež pomohol NOVÝ profil Thunderbirdu.

content: 1. doplněk mám nainstalovaný pouze češtinu, jiný ne, nikdy s ním problém nebyl 2. antivir vyloučený, mám pouze zabezpečení Win 3. Nový profil Thunderbird - netratím tím nějaká data , pomohlo by odstranit profil co není používán?
creator: peniasko.martin77

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu.Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO profilu Thunderbirdu - zvolte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.
creator: Ansamb

content: Možno bude stačiť iba sa prepnúť do toho "...defaul-release" profilu.

content: Check your online account to see if they are being received there. If they are, check the Thunderbird junk folder. If they are not found online, then your email provider is possibly rejecting them as spam. You might also check with senders to see if they receive messages about their emails not being sent.

content:
Hi,

I believe the only way to see that is to enable the "Find events page". To do that, please: Click the "Layout options" on your calendar (see the dark green arrow)

Then to control the period use the drop down (light green arrow) you can select it (next 7days for example) Please note that the events will be shown only in the "Find Events" area and will not reflect the calendar view.

I hope that helps. If you by any chance can't see the colors or the image, please let me know and I will add more description.

content: David and James; Apologies for my question going to a "wrong box". Please see below the copy of the email which I received from Mozilla. In any case my issues is as follows, and if you can help that would be fantastic: Subject: safely remove duplicate Sent folder in TB115 on Mac/Sonoma Recently I transferred content of my older Mac to a new M2 machine (at which time I was not aware of the recom. method for TB (on Google mail) transfer; then followed with an update of TB to 115, which resulted in a folder Sent (1.2GB) and folder Sent Mail (1.9GB) where the first is a shorter (6455 mails) duplicate of the latter (10300 emails). The smaller folder still exists on my older Mac and today I updated it also to TB114 with no observable effects. I also have a duplicate of Trash folders where one appears empty. So, the question remains: How to SAFELY remove the duplicate folder(s) without the loss of any emails. Can I just "remove" them? I suspect it is that simple but I do not want to screw-up anything. Your kind response would be greatly appreciated. Regards.
creator: jjg555

content: Okay, here is what I would do. THis has no official blessing: - first, confirm which is the official folder and which isn't. If the folder with more messages is NOT the default folder and you want it, you need to change that in account settings. - a way to confirm is to send a message and see where it is filed. - exit TB and log online and delete there the unwanted folder - restart TB and delete the folder there or click properties and subscribe and UNsubscribe - Another user had a similar problem and the steps worked. I have also used myself.
creator: davidsk

content: In Account Settings, Server Settings, Local Directory, Browse... to the new location, restart TB.

content:
f.flentge said
When sending mails, I have recently started receiving the message "Sending message failed. Could not be sent because connection waiting time to outgoing (SMTP) server has expired." How is this possible and what can I do about this?

Timeouts are often caused by antivirus scanning of outgoing mail. Run Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps and see if the error remains.
creator: sfhowes

content: Well, we can try. First, you need to give some info, such as any error messages in full, plus screenshots of your incoming server setting and your outgoing SMTP server settings. Tell us more and we'll go from there. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I regret you are having difficulties with Thunderbird; it is a complex product and some early confusion is not unusual. I encourage you to stay and advise of whatever difficulties you are experiencing. For example, we know that AT&T has its own special password requirements when used from ANY email client, and we can advise in resolving that. That is, if that's your difficulty, you will experience it with any email client, not just Thunderbird. And no email client receives the level of support that we provide. However, on your request, that was a donation, not a purchase. We on this support forum have no involvement with financial issues, so your request needs to be sent at this URL: https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/help/
creator: davidsk

content: See https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/#faq
creator: James

content: There are no static filters, so it's highly unlikely that spam/junk filtering is slowing things down. Thunderbird uses an adaptive filter that learns from your actions which messages are legitimate and which are junk. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: christ1

content:
I 'm not sure you are correct. Over the last few months one of my accounts has been receiving a lot of spam/scam emails in the inbox, 20 to 50 a day. I have been identifying them by clicking on the spam status icon. These then automatically move to the junk folder and future ones are also moved, however, there are still many coming in every day. I am in the process of eliminating the use of this email address but since it has been my go to address since e-mailing became available you can imagine how many sites it has been used on. In the mean time I want to reduce the number I have to handle.

I am sitting here watching Thunderbird work through my inbox and it is now taking up to 5 seconds to identify and move the spam to the junk box. This says to me that it is using some kind of reference file to identify these messages because it seems like some messages are further down the list than others. What I am hoping to do is to somehow fix this reference to target them more generally to reduce duplication in the reference.

content:
This is how I do it: - exit thunderbird - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to an external drive - do this as often as you feel necessary to protect data. I do it several times a month to prevent catastropic loss.

To restore: - install Thunderbird if necessary and then exit - copy the backed up Thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing thundebird folder - restart thunderbird

this assumes a Windows pc.
creator: davidsk

content: The -- at the beginning is a signature separator, and it appears to be for a pdf signature file. Check Account Settings for the signature. Only image, txt and html files are valid signature files.
